translations: <英>环岛，环形交叉路口；<英>（儿童坐的）旋转圆台；<英>旋转木马
绕路的，迂回的；（说话）绕圈子的，不直截了当的

phrs.translation: 以一种转弯抹角的方式

sentences.sentence: If you earn more, you pay more in tax, so it's all swings and roundabouts.
sentences.translation: 赚的越多，缴的税也越多，所以有得必有失。

sentences.sentence: In a variation of the game, drivers approach roundabouts at high speed and go around the wrong way.
sentences.translation: 该游戏还有一个变种，司机们需要以高速在非法的车道上绕行。

sentences.sentence: Though tens of thousands of roundabouts exist across Europe, America still has only 3, 000 of them.
sentences.translation: 虽然在整个欧洲地区建有上万个环形车道，但在美国却只有3000个。
